children.subject: <md>Unfortunately, we don't have good data to answer your question. If EECS 16B is able to be offered in the summer, I highly recommend you take it then.</md>

How common is it for juniors and seniors to get in when they phase 1 16b?

unless I take 16a and b next semester, I am pretty much stuck crossing my fingers for the next two years so I was hoping someone would be able to shed some light on that
<md>CS 70 does not depend on any concepts from the 16 series, so it would not be correct to list it as a prereq or coreq.</md>

<md>![image.png](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=paste%2Fkaddqruc8a45kz%2F19e5f99b5e83fa3197c032952fac60c5a233d4ea708ea7ae61a62b8e16f1b0f2%2Fimage.png)

16B notes repeatedly mention 70 as a followup course as does Professor Sahai and many other professors in the EECS dept like Prof Ranade</md>
<md>While there are individual instructors who believe this to be true, it has not been discussed and decided by the faculty collectively.</md>
why isn’t 16b a prereq/coreq for cs70 then? Also may want to pin this for visibility
No. None. See the post above for a long list of explanations.

hi, I am a junior declared CS major. Unfortunately, I did not get the enrollment priority. I am now 181 on waitlist. I am wondering if I should keep staying on the waitlist during phase 2 (in other words, what is the chance to get in).

Due to some issues which also are indicated by what I choose in the "priority enrollment form" that I cannot take 16B during summer. After sampling from people around me, I would reject the hypothesis that the chances to get the priority are equal for junior and senior, which I believe the priority in enrollment would be mostly given to senior students. 

Hence, I am wondering if we would still have the priority in enrollment when we are seniors? or if there are any suggestions for us? By the way, as soon as I received the warning from the EECS department at the end of last semester, I enrolled in 16A. Thanks so mcuh!

history.content:
<md>The short answer is no. This policy was decided by the faculty during or before the time most undergrads were in middle school.

There has been some concern, particularly in regards to LS students, about information flow so significant effort has been made to communicate this clearly and repeatedly.

Every one of the multiple CS Sample Program Plans shared for students who come to UCB for their first year of college (see https://berkeley.app.box.com/v/ugrad-sample-cs-freshmen) includes completing 16A and B before the end of sophomore year.
The enrollment policy for EECS 16A and B has been listed here for many years: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/faqs/getting-into-ee-classes#lower 

For spring 2021 enrollments, during or shortly before phase 1 began, e-mails were sent to students enrolled in 61A, 61B, and 70 (as well as a few others) to make sure students in your situation were aware of these long-standing policies. Emails with this information were also sent to declared EECS and LSCS majors as well as to the intended LSCS-list the department keeps; we sent it to the class lists because we know the LSCS intended list isn't complete.

Information was also posted (repeatedly) on the EECS 101 Piazza page.

While I don't think it will be added as a declaration requirement, the suggestion made about that in another post is a good one and I'll reach out to our advisors to see if this information can at least be added on this page https://eecs.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate/cs-ba 

At this point, anyone who wants to take EECS 16B in Spring 22, should use Phase 1 units to either enroll or get (and stay) on the waitlist. That's how you communicate that it is important to you.  At the end of phase 1, I will send an email to the waitlist (probably leaving out any 1st or 2nd year EECS, LSCS or undeclared LS students who we know have priority) with a link to a google form for people to share any particular reasons they think they should be given priority. (We'll be looking for something more specific and compelling than "I really didn't want to take it earlier.")

If people have other ideas about how to make sure this information is communicated clearly, please share in the discussion below.</md>
history.subject: EECS 16B: Requirement to Take by End of Sophomore Year -- Is this a new thing?
